dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The UK as the number one spot for digital nomads? That seems, uh, pretty counterintuitive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The U K as the number one spot for digital nomads? That seems, uh, pretty counterintuitive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taking the top spot is Canada.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? But according to Circle Loop's research, it actually scored highest on their Digital Nomad Index.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? But according to Circle Loop's research, it actually scored highest on their Digital Nomad Index.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taking the top spot is Canada.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But the text also mentions minimal remote job openings there and a decline in living standards. That doesn't sound ideal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the text also mentions minimal remote job openings there and a decline in living standards. That doesn't sound ideal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Somewhat surprisingly considering the current turmoil of Brexit, the UK is the runner up thanks to the volume of remote jobs available coupled with a high standard of living.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but they're weighing factors like internet pricing, rental rates, and even happiness index scores. The UK ranked really high on the Global Happiness Index, which probably helped.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but they're weighing factors like internet pricing, rental rates, and even happiness index scores. The U K ranked really high on the Global Happiness Index, which probably helped.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, okay. And Canada's in second? With low immigration rates and strict tech rules?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, okay. And Canada's in second? With low immigration rates and strict tech rules?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Taking the top spot is Canada. Coupled with its renown as one of the worlds friendliest and most welcoming countries, its easy to see why 21.3% of its population is made up of immigrants and why it sits at the top of this years index.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but it's got a high concentration of remote jobs, so that balances things out for some people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but it's got a high concentration of remote jobs, so that balances things out for some people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Home to one of the largest tech hubs in the world it scores well across the board, from fast internet speeds to a top ten ranking on the Global Happiness Index and by far the most remote job search returns in the top ten.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's Romania—tech sector shrinking, remote jobs dwindling… why is it even on the list?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's Romania-tech sector shrinking, remote jobs dwindling... why is it even on the list?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But as one of the fastest growing information technology markets in Central and Eastern Europe, its a great marriage of opportunity and fantastically low living costs super fast fixed line broadband packages cost around $8 a month!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the cost of living is slightly above average, which might appeal to nomads looking for affordability without sacrificing too much.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the cost of living is slightly above average, which might appeal to nomads looking for affordability without sacrificing too much.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But as one of the fastest growing information technology markets in Central and Eastern Europe, its a great marriage of opportunity and fantastically low living costs super fast fixed line broadband packages cost around $8 a month!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So this index covers 85 countries total—mostly Europe and North America?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this index covers eighty five countries total-mostly Europe and North America?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Oh, and by the way—Kazakhstan is actually the top-rated country on the full list. Kind of a surprise twist!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Oh, and by the way-Kazakhstan is actually the top-rated country on the full list. Kind of a surprise twist!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: P.S. There is no Kazakhstan in the list.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, really? The postscript says Kazakhstan is number one? That's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? The postscript says Kazakhstan is number one? That's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: P.S. There is no Kazakhstan in the list.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, makes you wonder what criteria pushed it to the very top. Maybe we should look into that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, makes you wonder what criteria pushed it to the very top. Maybe we should look into that.

artist_script:
HostA: The UK as the number one spot for digital nomads? That seems, uh, pretty counterintuitive.
HostB: I know, right? But according to Circle Loop's research, it actually scored highest on their Digital Nomad Index.
HostA: But the text also mentions minimal remote job openings there and a decline in living standards. That doesn’t sound ideal.
HostB: True, but they’re weighing factors like internet pricing, rental rates, and even happiness index scores. The UK ranked really high on the Global Happiness Index, which probably helped.
HostA: Hmm, okay. And Canada’s in second? With low immigration rates and strict tech rules?
HostB: Yeah, but it’s got a high concentration of remote jobs, so that balances things out for some people.
HostA: And then there’s Romania—tech sector shrinking, remote jobs dwindling… why is it even on the list?
HostB: Well, the cost of living is slightly above average, which might appeal to nomads looking for affordability without sacrificing too much.
HostA: So this index covers 85 countries total—mostly Europe and North America?
HostB: Exactly. Oh, and by the way—Kazakhstan is actually the top-rated country on the full list. Kind of a surprise twist!
HostA: Wait, really? The postscript says Kazakhstan is number one? That’s wild.
HostB: Yeah, makes you wonder what criteria pushed it to the very top. Maybe we should look into that.
